result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent Thomas Griese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Little Silver Lake Resort.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent Thomas Griese

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:32 am case called. Defendant Vincent Thomas Griese in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record by ADA Anderson. Attorney Szilagyi concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 60 days WCJ, consecutive to any sentence STAYED and placed on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day served.  CONDITIONS: AODA & follow through.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No Contact with Little Siver Lake Resort. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Defendant did not appear.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Counsel believes matter was resolved and was more than likely proceed to sentencing today.   As NOH was simply scheduled STC today, the Court is willing to adjourn to P/S hearing.  P/S scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Vincent Thomas Griese
Current: 6061 State Road 91, Oshkosh, WI 54904-9171 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2015)
Prior: 6141 N Rosewood Dr, Appleton, WI 54913

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests plea/sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 11:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests additional status-defendant is being revoked in Winnebago County.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:37 p.m. Defendant Vincent Thomas Griese in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. DA Blader requesting $500 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi takes no position on bond. Court orders $500 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:30 am.
